Questions.QuestionString: 29. When in the beta range, the propeller pitch is controlled. (Level 1)
Answers: A. directly from the power lever.

Answers: A. high power settings with higher than normal pitch settings when in flight.

C. low power settings with higher than normal pitch setting for ground manoeuvres.

Questions.QuestionString: 35. Synchronising can only be achieved if the slave propeller is. (Level 1)

B. within 20 rpm of the master.
C. within 100 rpm of the master.

Questions.QuestionString: 36. Synchronising is carried out to. (Level 1)

Questions.QuestionString: 37. The synchronisation governor monitors. (Level 1)
38. Synchronisation is used to. (Level 1)

Questions.QuestionString: 39. Synchronisation is used. (Level 1)

Questions.QuestionString: 40. The propeller synchronising system is put into operation by. (Level 2)
Answers: A. adjusting the engine rpm at required cruise speed then switching on the synchroniser.
B. adjusting the engine rpm then propeller rpm to required speed then switching on.
C. switching on the synchronizer then adjust the engine rpm so that all engines adjust together.

Questions.QuestionString: 41. Propellers are synchronised by the. (Level 2)

42. Unlike the automatic synchronizing system, the synchrophasing system of a two-propeller
aircraft. (Level 2)
Answers: A. sets the blade phase angle of two constant speed propellers.
B. causes the same rotation speed of the two propellers.
C. matches the blade angle of variable pitch propellers.

Questions.QuestionString: 43. A left handed propeller is one that. (Level 1)
Answers: A. rotates clockwise when viewed from the rear.
B. rotates clockwise when viewed from the front.
C. is fitted to an engine on the left side of the aircraft.

Questions.QuestionString: 44. In a propeller synchrophasing system, an electric actuator. (Level 2)
Answers: A. rotates (controls) the slave engine governor.
C. turns the flexible shaft leading to the trimmer assembly.

Questions.QuestionString: 45. If one signal is lost into the comparator unit when Synchrophasing is operating. (Level 2)
Answers: A. Synchrophasing is lost and the engines continue to function normally.
B. the slower engine immediately goes to feather.

C. both engines remain running until there is a difference, of commonly, (4 to 5 percent), at
which the slower of the engines is then feathered.

Questions.QuestionString: 46. Synchronisation controls RPM within what range?. (Level 2)
47. Electrically de-iced propeller slip rings have regular resistance checks for. (Level 1)

Questions.QuestionString: 48. Propeller anti-icing may be achieved by. (Level 1)
Answers: A. using iso-propyl alcohol de-icing fluid sprayed on the blade.
B. using commercial de-icing fluid sprayed on the pro.
C. a using hot air from the compressor.

C. wear on the slip rings.

Questions.QuestionString:
51. Insulation checks on propeller electrical heating elements should be carried out

B. oxidation of slip ring and brush gear assembly.

Questions.QuestionString: 72. The structural clearance of a multi engine aircraft propeller. (Level 3)

C. is taken from the ground.

B. removing metal from the opposite blade.
C. adding or removing lead wool to the hollow blade roots.

Questions.QuestionString: 79. Mechanical vibration relating to propellers in a piston powered aircraft. (Level 3)
Answers: A. is due to the crankshaft at intermittent power settings.
B. is due to the lead lag of the propeller compared to the engine.

C. is due to the power stroke of the engine and may have a more detrimental effect than
aerodynamic vibration.

Questions.QuestionString: 80. Aerodynamic Correction Factor (A C F). (Level 3)
Answers: B. is indicated in the form of degrees and minutes of pitch.

Questions.QuestionString: 81. A propeller with an adjustable blade can be adjusted. (Level 3)
Answers: A. on the ground with the engine stationary.
C. on the ground with the engine running.

Questions.QuestionString: 82. When on the ground with the engine idling the prop control should be. (Level 3)
Answers: A. fully aft with the mixture at idle.
B. fully aft with the mixture at rich.
C. fully forward with the mixture at idle.

Questions.QuestionString: 83. Operation with the engine at maximum boost should be limited to. (Level 3)
Answers: A. prop at fine to prevent overstressing the engine.
B. prop at course to prevent overstressing the engine.
C. prop at windmill to prevent overstressing the engine.

C. coat in Engineers blue to ensure seating in the propeller front boss.

Questions.QuestionString: 100. Blade tracking is adjusted by. (Level 2)

B. re-seating the propeller on the front and rear cones.
C. by fitting shims to the propeller shaft hub.

Questions.QuestionString: 101. Which of the following functions requires the use of a propeller blade station?. (Level 2)

B. fine pitch setting and advance the engine to the target RPM setting.
C. fine pitch setting and advance the engine to the max RPM setting.

105. How is the efficiency of a turbo prop engine assessed?. (Level 2)
Answers: A. By correcting propeller RPM for ambient Air temperature and barometric pressure.
B. By comparing compressor and propeller RPM against a reference figure.
C. By comparing torque meter pressure against a reference figure.

Questions.QuestionString: 106. The limits for a tracking check are. (Level 2)
Answers: A. 1/4 inch maximum difference between adjacent blades.
B. 1/8 inch maximum difference between opposite blades.
C. 1/8 inch maximum difference between all blades.

Questions.QuestionString: 107. After a lightning strike. (Level 2)
Answers: A. the prop must be tracked.
B. the propeller shaft should be checked for concentricity.
C. the heater elements should be checked for continuity and insulation.

Questions.QuestionString: 108. After overspeeding to 110%. (Level 2)
109. The propeller is driven by an engine with a performance measured in?
Answers: C. Shaft horse power or Brake horse power.

Questions.QuestionString: 110. Propellers can also be used as aerodynamic brakes by?
Answers: A. Reversing the direction of air acceleration.
B. Forward the direction of air acceleration.
C. Reversing the direction of air deceleration.

Questions.QuestionString: 111. The propeller is connected to the propeller shaft by?
112. The way the propeller works is based on?
113. Blade Angle is:
Answers:
A. The angle between the propeller chord and the rotational plane of the propeller the blade
angle

B. The angle of attack is the angle between the profile chord line and the relative air flow
towards it.
C. The angle between the rotational plane of the propeller and the relative velocity.

Questions.QuestionString:
114. As the geometry of the blade changes from the root to the tip, details on chord length,
chord thickness and blade angle refer to a particular reference station. This reference station
is normally located from?

115. Because of the higher velocity of the propeller wash behind the propeller plane, its
cross-section is?
116. The purpose of propeller twist is?
Answers: A. Coarsen the blade angle at the root.
B. To maintain Blade Angle along the blade.
C. To maintain Angle of Attack at the same value along the blade.

Questions.QuestionString: 117. Blade angle at the root is?
118. The static loads are superimposing at?
119. Propellers are subdivided into?
Answers: B. Adjustable pitch propellers and Variable pitch propellers.
C. Fixed pitch propellers, Adjustable pitch propellers and Variable pitch propellers.

Questions.QuestionString: 120. What are the characteristics of Fixed Pitch Propeller?
Answers: A. The blade angle (pitch) cannot be changed.
B. The blade angle can be changed on the ground when the engine is shut down.
C. The blade angle can be changed during operation.

Questions.QuestionString: 121. What are the characteristics of Variable Pitch Propeller?
Answers: A. The blade angle (pitch) cannot be changed.
B. The blade angle can be changed when the engine is shut down only.
C. The blade angle can be changed during operation.

125. With a propeller working on the constant speed principle, the RPM selected by the pilot
is kept constant by changing?
126. The propeller control lever is also called?
Answers: C. Speed lever or Condition lever.

Questions.QuestionString: 127. The propeller governor consists of?
Answers: A. A flyweight, a pilot valve, a speeder spring and two gear pumps.
B. Flyweights, a pilot valve, a speeder spring and a gear pump.
C. Flyweights, a pilot valve, two speeder springs and three gear pumps.

Questions.QuestionString:
128. To enable thrust to be reduced on the ground even further, turboprop engines have a
second control mode called?
129. The RPM range in alpha mode is relatively small, from:
130. A reduction in pitch leads to?
Answers: A. A smaller brake moment and thus higher RPM.
B. A larger brake moment and thus higher RPM.
C. A larger brake moment and thus lower RPM.

Questions.QuestionString: 131. The low RPM stop within the propeller is often set by?
Answers: A. The manufacturer at a higher value.
B. The manufacturer at a lower value.

C. The aircraft technician, so that maximum take-off RPM can be reached if the aircraft is
stationary.

Questions.QuestionString:
132. In the case of propellers with a feathering position, oil pressure works in the direction
of?
133. Engine and Propeller Control in Propeller Governing Mode in which operation mode?
Answers: B. Take Off and Flight Operation.

Questions.QuestionString: 134. Negative torque can occur if?
Answers: A. The engine suddenly loses power on ground.

B. Gusts hit the propeller and the force of air drives the propeller lower than the engine can do
it.

C. The engine suddenly loses power in flight or gusts hit the propeller and the force of air drives
the propeller faster than the engine can do it.

Questions.QuestionString:
135. The synchronizer calculates the propeller revolutions with the aid of inductive RPM
sensors on?

136. If the RPMs of the propellers of multiple engine aircraft deviate even only slightly from
each other, this results in?
Answers: B. Increasing the life span of the structure.

Questions.QuestionString:
137. Operating synchronizing systems automatically matches the revolutions of one or
several propellers to the RPM of?

138. When the synchronizer system is switched off, the actuator of the slave engine is
automatically set to?
139. The phase position of the slave propeller is?
Answers: A. Always the same with the master propeller.
B. Some degrees off that of the master propeller.
C. Not synchronized the master propeller.

Questions.QuestionString: 140. The synchrophasing function is not automatically activated if the power lever is at?

141. When the aircraft is flying under icing conditions, icing protection is necessary to prevent
ice from forming on?
142. How many main methods are used for icing protection?
143. The fluid anti-icing system of the propeller uses?

144. The fluid anti-icing system of the propeller, a pump injects the fluid into a slinger ring on
the propeller. From there it runs by?
Answers: A. Axial force onto the grooved anti-icing rubber.
B. Drag force onto the grooved anti-icing rubber.
C. Centrifugal force onto the grooved anti-icing rubber.

Questions.QuestionString:
145. Due to the amount of anti-icing fluid on board, the aircraft must be constantly
monitored, so the system works?
Answers: A. Fine and a precaution is not needed.
B. Only as a precaution and must be activated before icing begins.
C. Only as a precaution and must be activated after icing begins.

Questions.QuestionString:
146. In the electrical de-icing systems, Control components in the system switch the heating
element segments?
147. What is TSO?

151. Information on permissible repairs can be found in?
152. During periodic inspections the hub must be checked for?
153. When inspecting a composite blade, this has to be checked?
Answers: A. In the same way as all other composite structures.
B. In the same way as all other metal structures.

Questions.QuestionString: 154. Skin perforated damage of composite blade?

155. Cracks in the paint across the blade of WOODEN PROPELLERS are signs of flexural
vibrations. Cracks through the leading edge tipping are the result. If the tipping is cracked in
this way?
Answers: B. It must be replaced after 500 flight hours.
C. It must be replaced immediately.

Questions.QuestionString:
156. When handling small aircraft do not pull using the outside of the propeller blades but
use?

157. When an engine fitted with can oil operated propeller is stopped with the propeller in
the feather position, what do we must remember?
Answers: A. No warning or caution is required.
B. We can unfeather the propeller by attempting to start the engine.

C. Never unfeather the propeller by attempting to start the engine and actuating the feathering
mechanism.

Questions.QuestionString: 158. Installed propellers require to be kept in?
Answers: A. A clean condition and inspection is not required.
B. A clean condition and inspected at regular intervals for corrosion.
C. A clean condition and inspected at regular intervals for bending.

Questions.QuestionString: 159. Assembled propellers should be stored on?
Answers: A. Racks or stands in a clean, cold environment.
B. Racks in a clean, wet environment.
C. Racks or stands in a clean, dry and warm environment.

Questions.QuestionString: 160. The maximum storage period is up to 3 years with inhibiting checks every?
161. In the event that an engine ground run can not be carried out then?
Answers: A. The pitch change mechanism must be exercised by unfeathering the propeller only.
B. The pitch change mechanism must be exercised by feathering the propeller only.

C. The pitch change mechanism must be exercised by feathering and unfeathering the
propeller.

Questions.QuestionString:
162. If the propeller is to be stored ’on the wing’ for periods in excess of 3 months then the
pitch change mechanism should be?
Answers: A. Flushed out with an any oil and then covered with waxed paper.
B. Flushed out with an any oil and then covered with fabric.
C. Flushed out with an inhibiting oil and then covered with waxed paper.

Questions.QuestionString: 163. The propeller should be?
Answers:
A. Kept in the original manufacturers packing but if the original packing is not available it should
be wrapped in plastic material.
B. Not kept in the original manufacturers packing.

C. Kept in the original manufacturers packing but if the original packing is not available it should
be wrapped in waxed paper.
